turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Did you Know that Save the Children is an international non-governmental organization that promotes children's rights, provides relief and helps support children in developing countries.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I think I've heard of them, but aren't they religiously affiliated? I'm all for improving conditions for children in developing countries, but I don't really want money paying for evangelizing.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes they are affiliated with religion but all proceeds are put towards saving the children they do profit are use any funds for personal gain or spread of religion.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: How transparent are they about uses of their funds? Are they well rated by the watchdog groups that keep an eye on non-profits?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Save the Children is. Mention the organization's credentials and international impact

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: It's great to hear there are people out there doing such important work. Have you ever donated to them?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes I have , how much do you spend on unnecessary stuff like a bag of snack or candy. You Know small donations can help a lot of children and their families

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: Really? I suppose even with the economy being as hard as it is, exchange rates are still good enough to make a real impact.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes any donations made to helpless children make a real impact on their life. Not many kids get a real shot and they all deserve one If I had a chance to change a childs life foe the better and didn't I would not be able to live with myself.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's a good point, I think a lot of the times the little things we can do that have really positive impacts kind of get lost in the shuffle. If I can ask a personal question, how did you make room in your finances to donate?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I did't I just gave what I thougt cas right and took the blow . I thought about how these kids do without so much and realized I could do without once in order to help someone in need

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: So how did you decide what was right for you?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: I gave what was given to me . Over the next few chats I'm going to tell you the story of Bruce a child that like alot of these chidren need help but threw Save The Chidren found it. At the end Of our next few chats I'm going to ask you to  donate what you earn from this survey . I want you to think about what it means to save a child thats in trouble and how by saving that child you find new hope in your own life.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I'm certainly willing to listen. Tell me about Bruce.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Bruce was born to a single mother who was only 14 at the time he came into this world , the girls mother and father were ashamed of her pregnancy and kicked out of the house. Bruce was born and taken from the girl because she was to young to raise him and her was adobted out to a poor family that did their best to provide for him . The founder of save the children heard about the family and learned of Bruces story . He came to meet Bruce .

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That poor girl, being rejected by her own family like that. I'm glad that Bruce was taken in, though. How did the visit go?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: The owner got involved in Bruces life and sav the children went to work and provide food and cloths and school needs for Bruce . Bruce went own to join the save the children foundation after he completed college and is helping save children today.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: That's awesome! He even made it through college. I can see how he'd be really devoted to the organization, given the impact they had on his life.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes he is a force for good and was saved out of tragedy.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: If only all kids were so lucky. But I guess it takes a lot of work to try to help the ones who need it most

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Now I would Like to ask you to donate what you about to receive and and give to other in need. Yiur will go to help other just like that right now are looking or in room by themselves hoping for a miracle .Will you be that miracle and help a child like Bruce today?

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: I will. Be the change you want to see in the world, right?

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Yes you will . So how much of your earnings will you give, for a child that needs to be saved today?.

turns.speaker: speaker2
turns.text: 5 dollars buys a latte, and I think it should be easy for me to give up a coffee a month. I bet they have ways to set up recurring donations pretty easily.

turns.speaker: speaker1
turns.text: Your donation will be directly deducted from your task payment. You can choose any amount from $0 to all your payment. The research team will collect all donations and send it to Save the Children
